intro: Chaenocephalus cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's chaenocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, bristly seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
